business.headline: Trump's 26% tariffs on India come into effect, big Cabinet meet todayWith markets in a free fall since Donald Trump's reciprocal tariff announcement, the Union Cabinet will hold a crucial meeting today to strategise on ways to minimise the impact.
Sensex, Nifty open lower as RBI policy and global cues weigh on investorsThe S&P BSE Sensex fell by 255.49 points to 73,971.59, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 86.70 points to 22,449.15 as of 9:22 am.

RBI MPC: Will home loans get cheaper after today's policy announcement?In its last meeting held in February, the RBI cut the repo rate by 25 basis points. This was the first rate cut under RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra, and also the first cut in nearly five years.

Stock market today: Will RBI MPC decision pause Sensex, Nifty rally?The Sensex and Nifty ended Tuesday's session with big gains, but a global sell-off and worries about trade tensions are expected to affect today's opening.

Stocks to watch on April 9: NTPC, Adani Wilmar, Vodafone Idea, BPCLIn today's trade, many shares will be in focus due to key news developments. These include NTPC, BPCL, Adani Wilmar, Vodafone Idea, Cyient, PNB Housing Finance, and more.

S&P 500 hits lowest level in one year as hopes for Trump tariff relief fadeThe S&P 500 reached its lowest level in nearly a year after it reversed a strong morning rally, as hopes faded for any concessions or delays on President Donald Trump's global tariffs on US's trading partners set to come into effect on April 9.

US markets gain sharply on hopes of tariff talks: Will Dalal Street continue rally?If Wall Street wraps up today's session on a strong note, it could deliver a big dose of confidence to investors worldwide, especially in Asian markets.

US markets rally as Dow Jones jumps 1,100 points, Nasdaq, S&P surge 3%The surge in US stocks came as investors looked for any indication that the US might be open to easing some of its tougher tariffs through negotiations.

Opting for new tax regime? Know about this Rs 7,000 post office savings benefitAs per a government notification issued back in 2011, interest from post office savings accounts is exempt under Section 10(15) of the Income Tax Act.

Sensex, Nifty end higher on global recovery and RBI rate cut expectationsThe S&P BSE Sensex added 1,089.18 points to close at 74,227.08, while the NSE Nifty5o gained 374.25 points to end at 22,535.85.

RBI MPC to announce decision on April 9: Will there be a rate cut?Since the last MPC meeting, held in February 2025, a lot of things have changed, both positive and negative. While inflation has come down, and growth has started to pick up, there are fresh worries about the global economy.

'Economic nuclear war': Billionaire business titans slam Trump's tariff gambitDonald Trump's tariff agenda is fracturing elite support, with top businessmen — from Bill Ackman to Jamie Dimon — warning it risks recession, inflation, and global instability.

entertainment.headline: Chiranjeevi heads to Singapore with Pawan Kalyan after his son's fire injuryMegastar Chiranjeevi and his wife Surekha jetted off to Singapore with Andhra Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan on Tuesday. Pawan Kalyan's son, Mark Shankar, was injured in a school fire in Singapore.

Good Bad Ugly director admits his life changed after meeting 'rare gem' Ajith KumarGood Bad Ugly director Adhik Ravichandran opened up about his life after meeting Ajith Kumar. In a candid interview, he shared how the actor turned the spotlight on him.

Smriti Irani to make comeback in Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi? Ektaa Kapoor hintsDid filmmaker Ektaa Kapoor just confirm Smriti Irani's return to Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi reboot? Seems like the actor-turned-politician will make her much-awaited TV comeback after 15 years.

Allu Arjun-Atlee's poster copied from Dune? Internet points out similaritiesAllu Arjun and director Atlee's project was announced on Tuesday, on the occasion of the actor's birthday. However, the internet has pointed out that one of the posters of the film was allegedly copied from 'Dune'.

Priyanka Chopra, Nick Jonas kiss at his Broadway debut. Don't miss Malti's giftPriyanka Chopra and Nick Jonas shared a passionate kiss at his Broadway debut, 'The Last Five Years'. Their daughter, Malti, gifted a handmade poster for her father.
Producer Salim Akhtar, who launched Rani Mukerji, diesProducer Salim Akhtar died on April 8. He is survived by his wife, Shama Akhtar, and their son, Samad Akhtar.

Hulu outage hits thousands after Handmaid's Tale premiereHulu experienced a major outage on April 8, affecting over 13,000 users. Login and streaming issues were reported after The Handmaid's Tale premiere. Hulu advised basic troubleshooting and device restarts.
Kunal Kamra 'would rather check into mental hospital' than be on Bigg BossComedian Kunal Kamra shared a post on social media and revealed that he has been approached for the new season of Bigg Boss.

Odela 2 trailer: Tamannaah Bhatia as Shiva Shakti is ready to take on evilTamannaah Bhatia-starrer Odela 2 trailer released today, April 8. The supernatural thriller by Sampath Nandi will release in theatres on April 17.

Malaika Arora stuns with her dance moves on Roop Suhana on Hip Hop India 2. WatchActor Malaika Arora impressed fans with her moves again in a new video. The actor is judging the show with Remo D'Souza.

Actor Tillotama Shome gets emotional over director's remark and proving him wrongActor Tillotama Shome recently recalled a director's remarks on money and how she proved him wrong. The actor, in an interview, got emotional while recalling the incident.

Lenin title glimpse: Akhil Akkineni breaks away from lover boy imageThe title glimpse of Akhil Akkineni's upcoming film Lenin was unveiled on his birthday by father and actor Nagarjuna. The one-minute teaser hints at a powerful comeback of the actor.

Music icons Madonna, Elton John bury old hatchet: A healing momentMusic titans Madonna and Elton John have ended their decades-long feud after the former artiste paid a visit to John post-performance. Madonna shared a post about the same on her social media handle.
Logout trailer: Babil Khan's thriller is a wake-up call on phone addictionBabil Khan starring Logout trailer released on April 8. The film will premiere on Zee5 on April 18.

Alia Bhatt's latest ad has fans calling her Madhuri Dixit's 'unofficial daughter'Bollywood star Alia Bhatt's latest ad is trending on social media, where she is channelling a 90s vibe. The actor's avatar in the commercial is being praised by fans, with many comparing her with a younger Madhuri Dixit.
SRK, Suhana Khan's King delayed due to script setback: ReportShah Rukh Khan and Suhana Khan's King is reportedly delayed amid script changes. The film is expected to release in theatres in 2026.

Krrish 4: Hrithik Roshan in triple role, reuniting with Preity Zinta | ExclusiveActor Hrithik Roshan will most likely be seen in a triple role in the next Krrish film. The movie will also see him sharing screen space with close friend Preity Zinta once again.

Chef Vikas Khanna backs actor Gaurav Khanna as he gets trolled for copying a dishActor Gaurav Khanna faced criticism over the originality of his dessert on Celebrity MasterChef. However, chef Vikas Khanna has now come out in support of the actor and extended his best wishes to all the contestants of the season.
Govinda's wife Sunita Ahuja gets angry over divorce rumours: Dogs will barkGovinda's wife Sunita Ahuja reacted to divorce rumours. Angry with the rumours, Ahuja said, 'dogs will bark.'

general news.headline: 26/11 plotter Tahawwur Rana extradited from US, now on flight to India: SourcesUpon arrival in India, Tahawwur Rana will be held in the custody of the National Investigation Agency (NIA) for the initial weeks of interrogation and investigation.

Trump's 26% tariffs on India come into effect, big Cabinet meet todayWith markets in a free fall since Donald Trump's reciprocal tariff announcement, the Union Cabinet will hold a crucial meeting today to strategise on ways to minimise the impact.

RBI MPC: Will home loans get cheaper after today's policy announcement?In its last meeting held in February, the RBI cut the repo rate by 25 basis points. This was the first rate cut under RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra, and also the first cut in nearly five years.

Mahua Moitra claims fish shops shut, traders threatened at Delhi market; BJP reactsTrinamool's Mahua Moitra claimed that BJP leaders were threatening fish traders for running their business next to a temple in Delhi's Chittaranjan Park, a Bengali-dominated area. The BJP accused Moitra of trying to disturb communal harmony and police said the matter was under enquiry.

Is sunscreen harmful? Experts bust viral myths and set the record straightA section of the internet is trying to turn people against using sunscreen. Several viral videos claim that ingredients in chemical sunscreens (like oxybenzone and avobenzone) are absorbed through the skin and may cause a range of health issues. But what do dermatologists say?

US raises tariffs on China to 104%, Beijing says ready to 'fully offset' shocksThe US has escalated its trade confrontation with China with the imposition of 104 per cent tariffs on Chinese imports. The tariffs will come into effect from today, the White House confirmed.
Sensex, Nifty open lower as RBI policy and global cues weigh on investorsThe S&P BSE Sensex fell by 255.49 points to 73,971.59, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 86.70 points to 22,449.15 as of 9:22 am.

Trump's tariff feud with US Senator turns personal: Smallest neck I've seenDonald Trump's remarks come as Adam Schiff cements his role as one of Trump's most vocal and unrelenting critics on economic policy, warning that the administration's aggressive tariff strategy is steering the nation toward what he has ominously dubbed a looming "Trump recession".

Smriti Irani to make comeback in Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi? Ektaa Kapoor hintsDid filmmaker Ektaa Kapoor just confirm Smriti Irani's return to Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi reboot? Seems like the actor-turned-politician will make her much-awaited TV comeback after 15 years.

Who is Priyansh Arya? 24-year-old PBKS batter hits record IPL hundredIPL 2025, PBKS vs CSK: Priyansh Arya was at his very best when he scored a 39-ball hundred for the Punjab Kings in their match against the Chennai Super Kings on Tuesday in Mullanpur.

Manipur MLA survives attack by drug smugglers: They grabbed hand, tried choking meNational People's Party MLA Noorul Hassan was attacked by drug smugglers on April 5 when he was leaving his sister's house after a family dinner. He recalled the sequence of events, saying the attackers grabbed his hand and tried to choke him.

Raghuram Rajan points out the silver lining for India in US-China trade warIn an interview with India Today TV, Raghuram Rajan urged India to move swiftly but wisely on trade talks with the United States and reform its own tariff structure.

Allu Arjun-Atlee's poster copied from Dune? Internet points out similaritiesAllu Arjun and director Atlee's project was announced on Tuesday, on the occasion of the actor's birthday. However, the internet has pointed out that one of the posters of the film was allegedly copied from 'Dune'.

India, China should stand together against US abuse of tariffs: Chinese officialChina urged India to stand united against escalating US tariffs under Trump. As the Trump administration announced a 104 per cent tariffs on Chinese goods, Beijing vowed retaliation, calling Washington's moves unilateral and illegitimate.

Boys will be boys: White House reacts to Musk vs Navarro tariff feudElon Musk labelled Trump adviser Peter Navarro a "moron" in response to his tariff remarks, but the White House dismissed the clash as merely a difference of opinion.
Here is why Google is paying some of its employees to do nothingGoogle is apparently paying some of its employees to do nothing so that they don't take up another job.
Kunal Kamra 'would rather check into mental hospital' than be on Bigg BossComedian Kunal Kamra shared a post on social media and revealed that he has been approached for the new season of Bigg Boss.

Why temple ruins spotted in MP are a fascinating archaeological findRestoration of the 15 temples dating back to the 11th and 12th century is on, with plans to put the forested site on the state's ecotourism map

How Supreme Court cleared 10 Bills using extraordinary powersThe Supreme Court on Tuesday used its extraordinary powers to clear 10 Bills. It criticised Tamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi's "pocket veto" of the Bills, and resorted to Article 142, which was rarely used before, for "complete justice". The use of Article 142 had earlier been criticised as "judicial overreach".

Picasso vs Nazis: The rebel artist who redefined war, art and freedomPablo Picasso, who died on April 8, 1973, left behind not just paintings, but explosive stories of exile, rebellion, humour and genius. Behind his fame was a man of contradictions—brilliant, obsessive, wildly witty, and at times cruel.

Priyanka Chopra, Nick Jonas kiss at his Broadway debut. Don't miss Malti's giftPriyanka Chopra and Nick Jonas shared a passionate kiss at his Broadway debut, 'The Last Five Years'. Their daughter, Malti, gifted a handmade poster for her father.

Pentagon chief vows to reclaim Panama Canal, China slams US blackmail'China has never taken part in the management or operation of the Panama Canal, nor has it interfered in issues' concerning the waterway, said the Chinese embassy, calling on Washington to halt 'blackmail' and 'plundering' of Panama and other countries in the region.

Video: UP man lies on track, lets train pass over him for Instagram reel; arrestedIn Unnao, Uttar Pradesh, a youth named Ranjeet Chaurasia risked his life by lying on a railway track to shoot a reel, as a train passed over him. He added a song from Shah Rukh Khan's film Baadshah to the video and shared it on Instagram, seeking fame.

Rajasthan's Barmer sizzles at 46.4°C amid heatwave, yellow alert in Delhi todayRajasthan's Barmer recorded a scorching 46.4 degrees Celsius, making the place the hottest in the country as a searing heatwave swept several parts of India. In Delhi, where the temperature crossed the 40-degree mark, a yellow alert is in place for today.

sports.headline: PBKS vs CSK: BCCI punishes Glenn Maxwell for breaching IPL code of conductPunjab Kings all-rounder Glenn Maxwell was fined and handed a demerit point after breaching the IPL Code of Conduct during his side's win over CSK, becoming the sixth player this season to be penalised by the BCC.

Priyansh Arya is a bright prospect for India: Shashank praises PBKS youngsterPunjab Kings batter Shashank Singh praised Priyansh Arya after the young opener hit the fastest hundred by an uncapped player and the fifth-fastest hundred in IPL history.

CSK coach Fleming highlights positives after PBKS loss: We batted a bit betterChennai Super Kings coach Stephen Fleming highlighted his side's improved batting performance in Tuesday's narrow loss against Punjab Kings. However, the CSK coach slammed the team's poor fielding and bowling after their fourth consecutive IPL 2025 loss.

Shashank Singh credits Brian Lara for confidence booster after 52 vs CSKIPL 2025, PBKS vs CSK: Shashank Singh scored 52 runs off 36 balls as the Punjab Kings recorded their third win of the tournament after beating Chennai Super Kings by 18 runs on Tuesday in Mullanpur.

CSK lost on the field, top-order failures: coach Fleming after PBKS lossChennai Super Kings head coach Stephen Fleming blamed poor fielding and inconsistent top-order batting for the team's recent struggles, following their fourth consecutive defeat in IPL 2025 against a dominant Punjab Kings.

How timid Priyansh Arya turned fearless to stun CSKIPL 2025, PBKS vs CSK: Priyansh Arya bagged a golden duck against the Rajasthan Royals, but he made an incredible comeback to score a 39-ball hundred against five-time champions Chennai Super Kings on Tuesday in Mullanpur.

Story of CSK in IPL 2025: Jaffer's 'net-run rate' jibe at after PBKS lossWasim Jaffer poked fun at Chennai Super Kings with a cheeky meme, highlighting how the team seems more focused on saving their net run rate than winning matches during what has been a tough IPL season so far.

Didn't understand CSK's decision to retire Devon Conway: Michael ClarkeFormer Australia cricketer Michael Clarke slammed Chennai Super Kings (CSK) management's decision to retire out Devon Conway against Punjab Kings in Match 22 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

Markram gives insights into plan to counter Varun Chakravarthy and Sunil NarineLucknow Super Giants (LSG) batter Aiden Markram gave insights into their plan to counter Sunil Narine and Varun Chakravarthy's threat in the game against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR). Markram scored 47 (28) and added 99 runs for the first wicket with Mitchell Marsh as LSG beat KKR by four runs.

Samson's captaincy comeback had calming influence on squad: Shane BondRajasthan Royals (RR) assistant and fast bowling coach Shane Bond feels Sanju Samson's comeback as captain has had a calming influence on the entire team. Samson finally returned as captain and wicketkeeper for Rajasthan in the previous game after playing first three matches as an Impact Substitute due to injury.

Washington Sundar in awe of GT bowlers: Restricting teams to below 180 is amazingIPL 2025, GT vs RR: In the press conference before the match against Rajasthan Royals, Washington Sundar heaped praise on the Gujarat Titans' bowlers for their wholehearted efforts.

Story of CSK in IPL 2025: Jaffer's 'net-run rate' jibe at after PBKS lossWasim Jaffer poked fun at Chennai Super Kings with a cheeky meme, highlighting how the team seems more focused on saving their net run rate than winning matches during what has been a tough IPL season so far.

Markram scored 47 (28) and added 99 runs for the first wicket with Mitchell Marsh as LSG beat KKR by four runs.

Samson finally returned as captain and wicketkeeper for Rajasthan in the previous game after playing first three matches as an Impact Substitute due to injury.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
